jobs.title: Developer Advocate Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
More about Browserbase

Browserbase powers web browsing capabilities for AI agents and applications. We manage headless browser infrastructure for automations that interact with websites, fill out forms, and replicate user actions.

We reached $1M+ ARR in less than 10 months last year and are continuing to grow fast. Backed by Kleiner Perkins and CRV, our scrappy, fast-moving team is building on our CEO's founding vision to power the world's best AI tools and help everyone automate the web.

Position Overview

As a Developer Advocate at Browserbase, you'll be the bridge between our platform and the developer community, particularly those working in AI, web automation, and data collection. You'll help shape our developer experience, create compelling technical content, and build relationships with developers across AI frameworks, browser automation tools, and web scraping communities. Your passion for teaching and advocacy will drive adoption of our headless browser platform and help developers leverage the full potential of browser automation at scale.

This is our first developer advocate hire at Browserbase! You should be comfortable building our community from the ground up and willing to commit your personal social accounts to promoting Browserbase and browser automation.

Key Responsibilities

  • Developer Advocacy: Represent Browserbase at AI, automation, and web development conferences, meetups, and online events to educate developers about our platform.

  • Content Creation: Produce high-quality technical content including tutorials, sample applications, videos, and documentation that showcase integrations with Playwright, Puppeteer, Selenium, and AI frameworks like crewAI, Langchain, and Vercel AI SDK.

  • Integration Examples: Create demo projects showing how to use Browserbase with popular AI tools and browser automation libraries for various use cases.

  • Community Building: Foster an active and engaged developer community through forums, social media, Discord/Slack channels, and GitHub discussions.

  • Technical Feedback Loop: Gather and synthesize developer feedback to inform platform improvements and new features.

  • Educational Materials: Develop workshops, webinars, and training materials demonstrating key features like the Session Inspector, Stealth Mode, and Custom Extensions.

  • Use Case Cultivation: Identify and document innovative use cases for Browserbase in AI agent tools, workflow automation, and web scraping.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in web development, with strong knowledge of JavaScript, React, Next.js, and Browserbase.

  • Practical experience with headless browser automation tools like Playwright, Puppeteer, Selenium, or Stagehand.

  • Familiarity with AI frameworks and tools like Langchain, crewAI, or Vercel AI SDK

  • Understanding of web scraping techniques, challenges, and ethical considerations.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly. You like being on camera, filming videos, and are willing to dedicate your social media feeds to Browserbase.

  • Demonstrated ability to create technical content (videos, blog posts, tutorials, documentation).

  • Public speaking experience at tech conferences, meetups, or webinars (preferred).

  • Active presence in developer communities and/or contributions to open source projects.

  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently.

Why you should join us

We’ll make sure you’re fully covered with health insurance, tech setup, flexible time off, and office snacks. We offer competitive salary and equity packages, and take careful consideration of each hire on our small team.

We are fully in office 5 days a week in San Francisco near Union Square. We have a hard working, collaborative culture, and we’re energized by the prospect of Browserbase powering the largest AI applications.

Working here means having flexibility and ownership over every piece of the product. This is a place to learn a ton, build your brand, and make an impact.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Stagehand)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Stagehand is Browserbase’s framework for automating browsers with code. The Stagehand team creates developer tools at the intersection of AI and open source — making browser automation smarter, simpler, and more powerful.

What you'll do

  • Build, operate, and grow the Stagehand framework — developer-first APIs with ~2M monthly downloads and ~17k stars. Design and implement tools that make automating the web simple and powerful.

  • Work with frontier AI labs (OpenAI, Google, and others) to improve models, benchmark capabilities, and make them more accessible to developers.

  • Deploy production-ready AI solutions that impact millions of customers, shaping the future of the web.

  • Help define, scope, and prioritize projects that shape the future of developer tooling.

  • Document as you go and share your knowledge with the team.

Technical skills:

  • Strong coding skills: preferably TypeScript; also valuable: Python/Go.

  • Experience building developer tools, frameworks, or libraries that others depend on.

  • Experience building AI agents/LLMs, distributed systems, or applying reinforcement learning.

  • Familiarity with web automation frameworks (Puppeteer, Playwright, Selenium) or web scraping; huge bonus: Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) experience.

  • Track record of open source contributions or public developer projects.

You're a good fit if you:

  • Have high agency: you can set direction, make judgment calls, and drive projects forward without waiting for perfect clarity.

  • Have a strong sense of ownership and bias toward action.

  • Can drive projects independently, with high accountability without much outside input.

  • Communicate clearly in writing and in person, and choose the right medium for the message.

  • Are adaptable and able to dive into unfamiliar systems, learn quickly, and make sound technical decisions.

  • Enjoy collaborating with a small, ambitious team in a fast-paced environment.

  • Are excited to work 5 days a week in our San Francisco HQ (or open to relocating here).

Why join us:

  • Shape the future of browser automation with AI-driven developer tools.

  • Work in the open: collaborate with and contribute to the broader open source community.

  • Collaborate with a small, high-bar team of engineers who care deeply about quality.

  • Join an ambitious startup where your impact will be felt immediately.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Distributed Systems)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Core (aka Browserbase Core Infrastructure) is the backbone of everything we do. This team keeps our browsers running at scale, solving massive distributed systems challenges and making sure our platform is fast, reliable, and scalable.

What you’ll do

  • Build, operate, and grow the Browserbase Core platform — designing and developing robust, scalable distributed backends with developer-friendly APIs.

  • Work closely with the rest of Engineering, gathering input and providing great support so every team can build on Core with confidence.

  • Help define, scope, and review key projects; set priorities on the roadmap; and sequence deliverables that push the platform forward.

  • Establish and reinforce best practices around development, operations, and reliability.

  • Continuously enhance the platform to meet rapidly expanding customer adoption and demand.

  • Investigate, troubleshoot, and resolve operational issues that arise in production.

  • Document as you go and share your knowledge with the team.

Technical skills

  • Deep experience building and scaling distributed systems, with scale on the order of hundreds or thousands of instances.

  • Strong expertise coding in Go or Typescript; bonus if you’ve touched Firecracker or similar VMMs.

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes and Docker, message queues, relational databases, automated testing, performance optimization, and zero-downtime multi-region deployments.

  • A systems-thinking mindset you understand how infrastructure choices ripple all the way up to customer experience.

You’re a good fit if you…

  • Have high agency: you can set direction, make judgment calls, and drive projects forward without waiting for perfect clarity.

  • Have a strong sense of ownership and bias toward action.

  • Can drive projects independently, with high accountability without much outside input.

  • Communicate clearly in writing and in person, and choose the right medium for the message.

  • Are adaptable and able to dive into unfamiliar systems, learn quickly, and make sound technical decisions.

  • Enjoy collaborating with a small, ambitious team in a fast-paced environment.

  • Are excited to work 5 days a week in our San Francisco HQ (or open to relocating here).

Why join us

  • Work on some of the hardest problems in modern infrastructure.

  • Collaborate with a small, high-bar team of engineers who care deeply about quality.

  • Build core technology that every Browserbase product depends on.

  • Join an ambitious startup where your impact will be felt immediately.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Director)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Director is where Browserbase meets the end user. It’s an accessible interface that gives people the power to automate the web without needing to write code, opening up capabilities that were once only for developers. We’re building tools that feel like magic to use, yet are powerful enough to tackle real-world workflows. If you’re curious about how people interact with technology and excited to shape new patterns of human-computer interaction, you’ll love this team.

What you’ll do

  • Build and grow Director, product that allows non technical users to automate the web.

  • Work across the stack to create seamless, intuitive user experiences backed by robust systems.

  • Prototype, test, and iterate quickly on new product ideas and workflows.

  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering to shape how people use AI to interact with the web.

  • Help define, scope, and review key projects; prioritize roadmap objectives; and sequence our deliverables.

  • Document as you go and share your knowledge with the team.

Technical skills

  • Strong full-stack engineering skills (TypeScript, React, Node.js, or similar).

  • Experience building consumer-facing products or developer tools with great UX.

  • Comfort working in AI/ML-powered applications (LLMs, agents, or related tooling).

  • A strong product sense and design intuition — you care about usability, polish, and user delight, not just functionality.

You’re a good fit if you…

  • Have high agency: you can set direction, make judgment calls, and drive projects forward without waiting for perfect clarity.

  • Have a strong sense of ownership and bias toward action.

  • Can drive projects independently, with high accountability without much outside input.

  • Communicate clearly in writing and in person, and choose the right medium for the message.

  • Are adaptable and able to dive into unfamiliar systems, learn quickly, and make sound technical decisions.

  • Enjoy collaborating with a small, ambitious team in a fast-paced environment.

  • Are excited to work 5 days a week in our San Francisco HQ (or open to relocating here).

Why join us

  • Work on some of the hardest problems in modern infrastructure and applied AI.

  • Build core products that define how people automate the web.

  • Collaborate with a small, high-bar team of engineers who care deeply about quality.

  • Join an ambitious startup where your impact will be felt immediately.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer, Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
More about Browserbase

Browserbase powers web browsing capabilities for AI agents and applications. We manage headless browser infrastructure for automations that interact with websites, fill out forms, and replicate user actions.

We reached $1M+ ARR in less than 10 months last year and are continuing to grow, fast. Backed by Kleiner Perkins and CRV, our scrappy, fast-moving team is building on our CEO's founding vision to power the world's best AI tools and help everyone automate the web.

About the Role

Browserbase is looking for a Sales Engineer who can book meetings, guide prospects through demos, and close product-led sales deals.

This hybrid role at the intersection of sales and engineering requires:

  • A technical background for debugging & digging into code on calls.

  • Charisma and a customer centered mindset for running excellent demo calls to onboard customers.

  • Top notch organization & follow up skills for managing a healthy pipeline of deals and future deals.

This role will own all of the follow up from our inbound contact form, upgrade messages for when our customers are ready for an Enterprise plan, send contracts and negotiate deals, and support customers as they start using the product, and more.

Key Responsibilities

  • Give Technical Demos: As users of all types are getting to know Browserbase, you will educate and demo the full scope of our products.

  • Close Deals: You’ll serve as the technical expert articulating Browserbase’s technical value proposition & competitive differentiation. You’ll also serve as the main point of contact to get customers over the finish line.

  • Sales & Pipeline Generator: You keep an air tight book of business, following up with new leads, finding the right people to talk to, and watching usage and trends of current customers to identify opportunities for expansion.

  • Enable Customers: Build proof-of-concepts and sample implementations that showcase Browserbase's capabilities in customer-specific environments. Provide technical guidance to customers across self-serve and enterprise, ensuring smooth onboarding and successful implementation.

  • Technical Team Member: Stay current on industry trends, competitive offerings, and emerging technologies in our space and help to train and enable the broader team on our product.

Qualifications

You might be a great fit if you’ve worked as an SDR or full-cycle AE and are looking to get more technical. Maybe you’ve completed a coding course or bootcamp and want to apply those skills without becoming a full-time engineer. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys being at the intersection of sales and engineering. Bonus points for Hackathon participants!

  • 1-3 years of Sales or customer facing experience (SDR/BDR, Account Executive with a PLG focus).

  • Technical background and comfort reading/writing simple code snippets.

  • Experience or interest in web development, databases, or developer tools.

  • Excellent communication skills with ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences. Lots of zoom calls in this role.

  • Experience conducting effective product demonstrations and technical presentations.

  • Problem-solving mindset with the ability to quickly understand customer challenges.

  • Comfort with a fast-paced startup environment and ability to work with ambiguity.

  • Customer-centric approach with a focus on building long-term relationships.

Why you should join us

We’ll make sure you’re fully covered with health insurance, tech setup, flexible time off, and office snacks. We offer competitive salary and equity packages, and take careful consideration of each hire on our small team.

We are fully in office 5 days a week in San Francisco near Union Square. We have a hard working, collaborative culture, and we’re energized by the prospect of Browserbase powering the largest AI applications.

Working here means having flexibility and ownership over every piece of the product. This is a place to learn a ton, build your brand, and make an impact. We also care deeply about supporting your growth. You’ll have direct mentorship, opportunities to stretch into new skills, and the backing of a team that wants you to succeed.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
More about Browserbase

Browserbase powers web browsing capabilities for AI agents and applications. We manage headless browser infrastructure for automations that interact with websites, fill out forms, and replicate user actions.

We reached $1M+ ARR in less than 10 months last year and are continuing to grow, fast. Backed by Kleiner Perkins and CRV, our scrappy, fast-moving team is building on our CEO's founding vision to power the world's best AI tools and help everyone automate the web.

About the Role

Browserbase is seeking a motivated Sales Engineer to join our growing technical sales team. You'll work closely with our Growth, Support, and Eng teams to drive technical adoption of our platform.

This includes conducting compelling product demonstrations, developing custom solutions, and enabling our customers to easily build with Browserbase.

Our product is highly technical, so we’re looking for engineers who have both strong tech fundamentals and customer empathy.

Key Responsibilities

  • Technical Guidance & Enablement: Act as the primary technical advisor for prospects and customers. Help them onboard, design solutions, troubleshoot issues, and make the most of Browserbase’s APIs and infrastructure.

  • Close Deals: You’ll serve as the technical expert articulating Browserbase’s technical value proposition & competitive differentiation. You’ll also serve as the main point of contact to get customers over the finish line.

  • Build POCs: Build proof-of-concepts and sample implementations that showcase Browserbase's capabilities in customer-specific environments.

  • Sales <> Product: Identify and document customer requirements, collaborating with the product team to ensure alignment with our roadmap and customer communication around new features.

  • Resources: Create technical content including demo environments, guides, and reference architectures to support the sales process.

  • Technical Team Member: Stay current on industry trends, competitive offerings, and emerging technologies in our space and help to train and enable the broader team on our product.

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of Sales Engineering, Solutions Architecture, or similar customer-facing technical role.

  • Strong technical background with experience in web development, databases, or developer tools.

  • Excellent communication skills with ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences. Lots of zoom calls in this role.

  • Experience conducting effective product demonstrations and technical presentations.

  • Problem-solving mindset with the ability to quickly understand customer challenges.

  • Comfort with a fast-paced startup environment and ability to work with ambiguity.

  • Customer-centric approach with a focus on building long-term relationships.

Why you should join us

We’ll make sure you’re fully covered with health insurance, tech setup, flexible time off, and office snacks. We offer competitive salary and equity packages, and take careful consideration of each hire on our small team.

We are fully in office 5 days a week in downtown San Francisco. We have a hard working, collaborative culture, and we’re energized by the prospect of Browserbase powering the largest AI applications.

Working here means having flexibility and ownership over every piece of the product. This is a place to learn a ton, build your brand, and make an impact.

 - Build POCs: Build proof-of-concepts and sample implementations that showcase Browserbase's capabilities in customer-specific environments.

 - Resources: Create technical content including demo environments, guides, and reference architectures to support the sales process.

 - Technical Team Member: Stay current on industry trends, competitive offerings, and emerging technologies in our space and help to train and enable the broader team on our product.


QUALIFICATIONS

 - 2+ years of Sales Engineering, Solutions Architecture, or similar customer-facing technical role.

 - Strong technical background with experience in web development, databases, or developer tools.

 - Excellent communication skills with ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences. Lots of zoom calls in this role.

 - Experience conducting effective product demonstrations and technical presentations.

 - Problem-solving mindset with the ability to quickly understand customer challenges.

 - Comfort with a fast-paced startup environment and ability to work with ambiguity.

 - Customer-centric approach with a focus on building long-term relationships.


WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

We’ll make sure you’re fully covered with health insurance, tech setup, flexible time off, and office snacks. We offer competitive salary and equity packages, and take careful consideration of each hire on our small team.

We are fully in office 5 days a week in downtown San Francisco. We have a hard working, collaborative culture, and we’re energized by the prospect of Browserbase powering the largest AI applications.

Working here means having flexibility and ownership over every piece of the product. This is a place to learn a ton, build your brand, and make an impact.
